1.brief: 'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
(figuratively) to love; by implication, a love-token, lover, friend; specifically an uncle
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a horn (as projecting); by implication, a flask, cornet; by resemblance. an elephant's tooth (i.e. ivory), a corner (of the altar), a peak (of a mountain), a ray (of light); figuratively, power
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness

2.brief: properly, to be weighty; but used only in the sense of lapidation or its contrary (as if a delapidation)
properly, to strike in, i.e. fix; specifically, to plant (literally or figuratively)
a vine stock (properly, one yielding purple grapes, the richest variety)
a tower (from its size or height); by analogy, a rostrum; figuratively, a (pyramidal) bed of flowers
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
a trough (as dug out); specifically, a wine-vat (whether the lower one, into which the juice drains; or the upper, in which the grapes are crushed)
to cut or carve (wood, stone or other material); by implication, to hew, split, square, quarry, engrave
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

3.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or
between (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, either...or

4.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect

'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

a circumvallation; by implication, an inclosure
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

6.brief: to place (in a very wide application)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to arrange as a battle, a vineyard (to hoe); hence, to muster and so to miss (or find wanting)
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
a thorn; also (from its keenness for scratching) a gem, probably the diamond
scrub or trash, i.e. wild growth of weeds or briers (as if put on the field)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)

8.brief: properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
cessation, i.e. an end (especially of the earth); often used adverb, no further; also the ankle (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or foot
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

ten (as an accumulation to the extent of the digits)

to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
a bath or Hebrew measure (as a means of division) of liquids
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity
properly, a bubbling up, i.e. of water, a wave; of earth, mire or clay (cement); also a heap; hence, a chomer or dry measure

an ephah or measure for grain; hence, a measure in general

11.brief: literally, to load up (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to start early in the morning
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
an intoxicant, i.e. intensely alcoholic liquor
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
to loiter (i.e. be behind); by implication to procrastinate
properly, a breeze, i.e. (by implication) dusk (when the evening breeze prevails)

12.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a skin-bag for liquids (from collapsing when empty); hence, a vase (as similar in shape when full); also a lyre (as having a body of like form)
drink, by implication, drinking (the act); also (by implication) a banquet or (generally) feast
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
